result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin Joseph Kohl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin Joseph Kohl

State informs the court the parties have reached an agreement.
Defendant has paid restitution up front.
 State informs the court this matter is resolved and files plea questionnaire and waiver of rights with the court.
Defendant enters plea of "GUILTY" .
Court questions defendant re: his plea and waiver of rights.
Court finds plea and waiver is made freely, voluntarily, and intelligently.
Court accepts plea and finds the defendant "GUILTY".
State moves for costs in the amount of $200.00.
